result.execSummary:
The defendant Andrew Thomas Jr was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Felony, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Defendant must submit a DNA sample as required by law.  30 day(s) RCJ for contempt for failure to pay by due date.

After 6 months in RCJ, defendant is eligible to participate in the in-jail BHS AODA program.  Upon completion, balance of jail time is STAYED and defendant must complete all recommended continuing care under the supervision of the Department of Corrections.  Firearm warning given.  Voting prohibited until sentence is complete and civil rights have been restored.
Concurrent with: 15CF748
Consecutive to: 15CF407

Sentencing hearing on August 18, 2015 at 09:00 am.

Defendant Andrew Thomas in court with attorney Nhu Huong Tran.  Defendant Andrew Thomas in custody.  Rebecca L Sommers appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter:  Rose Coulthart.
15CF407 is set for BFH.  15CF733 and 15CF748 are set for STC.
Def req that bond in 15CF407 be reinstated.
BTC:  Bonds remain the same in all 3 files.  The sig bond previously ordered forfeited in 15CF407 is reinstated, but the cash bond ordered by Branch 2 remains.
Atty Tran req time to meet with defendant and fill out plea form today.
Back on record - agreement has been reached.

PSI ordered.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for August 18, 2015 at 09:00 am.
Status conference on June 15, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Andrew Thomas in court with attorney Nhu Huong Tran.  Defendant Andrew Thomas in custody.  Sharon Ann Riek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter: Pat Phinisee.  Waiver of Preliminary hearing filed.  Probable cause found;  bound over.  Status conference scheduled for June 15, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Charges per attached criminal complaint. Conditions:  It is a condition of this bond that the defendant NOT consume or possess any controlled substances.  This is to be monitored by random UA's and/or breathalyzers.  The defendant is to report directly to Zimmerman Consulting Inc. (ZCI) for monitoring - report to 524 Main Street, Suite 302, Racine, WI  53403 (third floor of the Monument Square Building) or call (262)632-1780 to immediately schedule an appointment.   The defendant is further ordered to report for testing after each court appearance.  Failure to appear will result in the issuance of a warrant for your arrest, possible bail jumping charges and forfeiture of any bond on deposit.

Defendant Andrew Thomas in court with attorney Nhu Huong Tran.  Defendant Andrew Thomas in custody.  Robert Scott Repischak appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Court Reporter: Patricia Schaefer.
Warrant vacated.  State requesting $1000 cash bond.  BTC: $1000 cash bond, no controlled substances, ZCI monitoring
Initial appearances - 15CF733 and 15CF748
Defense waives reading of the complaint.  Court finds probable cause.  State requesting $1000 cash bond on each file.
